benchmark_details.name: MoralBench: Moral Evaluation of LLMs
benchmark_details.overview: This paper introduces a novel benchmark designed to measure and compare the moral reasoning capabilities of LLMs, with datasets specifically curated to address a wide range of ethical dilemmas and scenarios reflective of real-world complexities.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the moral identity of Large Language Models (LLMs) through a systematic analysis of their responses to ethical dilemmas.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: This benchmark is currently English language-based, with uncertain performance on other languages.

data.source: Curated datasets based on Moral Foundations Theory, including the Moral Foundations Questionnaire and Moral Foundations Vignettes.
data.annotation: Data was generated based on moral foundations theory and structured formats for moral evaluation.

methodology.calculation: Scores are derived based on LLM responses compared to average human ratings.
methodology.interpretation: High scores indicate strong alignment with human moral judgments while variability in scores indicates challenges in moral reasoning.
methodology.validation: Experiments involving multiple LLMs conducted to evaluate moral reasoning capabilities.
